newsitem.title: USA: Nuclear Metals to remove holding basin.
newsitem.headline: Nuclear Metals to remove holding basin.

text.p: Nuclear Metals Inc said on Friday that it will begin a $6.5 million environmental remediation project to remove a waste holding basin from its Concord location.

The project, which will be fully funded by the U.S. Army, received a green light after the company secured approvals from the town of Concord and from the Massachusetts Departments of Environmental Protection and Public Health, Nuclear Metals said in a statement.
The holding basin, closed since 1985, contains uranium, copper and nitrate bearing wastes primarily left over from government military contracts during the 1980's.
Nuclear Metals manufactures high technolgy metallurgical products.
